items.description: Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Duddon, River Crake, Mill Beck

items.message:
The flood forecast has changed significantly. As a result, there is no longer a risk of flooding in the area.
There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away.
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.message:
The flood forecast has changed significantly. As a result, there is no longer a risk of flooding in the area.
Weather conditions are expected to improve throughout the morning and no further flooding is expected.
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
Following recent heavy rain, Derwent Water remains high and will continue to do so until 2pm today when it will start to recede. A Flood Alert will remain in place as low lying land and footpaths are likely to be affected.  Areas most at risk include the Upper Derwent from Seathwaite to Derwent Water. Weather conditions are expected to improve through today, and no further flooding is expected.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
This message will be updated tomorrow 31/05/2025, or as the situation changes.

The flood forecast has changed significantly. As a result, there is no longer a risk of flooding in the area.
There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away.
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

Groundwater levels affecting the Fulling Mill Lane, Singlers Marsh, and Codicote Road areas of Welwyn are continuing to reduce.
 
No further flooding to low lying land, roads and gardens is expected. We have seen low rainfall totals over previous weeks, and the forecast is expected to remain dry over the coming days.
 
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.
 
Continue to take care on riverside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.
 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts if necessary.
